1. ndx-ecg¶

Version alpha Nov 13, 2023

1.1. Format Overview¶

1.1.1. ndx-ecg¶

  • Description: This extension is developed to extend NWB data standards to incorporate ECG recordings.

  • Name: ndx-ecg

  • Version: 0.1.0

  • Authors:

    • Hamidreza Alimohammadi ([AT]DefenseCircuitsLab)

  • Contacts:

    • alimohammadi.hamidreza@gmail.com

  • Schema:

    • namespace: core

    • neurodata_types: [‘TimeSeries’, ‘Device’, ‘NWBDataInterface’, ‘LabMetaData’]

    • namespace: hdmf-common

    • neurodata_types: [‘DynamicTable’, ‘VectorData’]

    • source: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

1.1.2. Type Hierarchy¶

  • Container

    • DynamicTable

      • ECGChannels

      • ECGElectrodes

    • NWBContainer

      • Device

        • ECGRecDevice

      • LabMetaData

        • ECGRecordingGroup

      • NWBDataInterface

        • AuxiliaryAnalysis

        • ECG

        • HeartRate

        • TimeSeries

          • CardiacSeries

  • Data

    • ElementIdentifiers

    • VectorData

1.2. Type Specifications¶

1.2.1. ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml¶

1.2.1.1. CardiacSeries¶

Overview: A group to store standardized cardiac time-series, e.g., ECG and HeartRate, including acquisitions, processed cardiac series or auxiliary analysis.

CardiacSeries extends TimeSeries and includes all elements of TimeSeries with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: TimeSeries

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Inherits from: TimeSeries, NWBDataInterface, NWBContainer, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.1

Table 1.1 Datasets, Links, and Attributes contained in <CardiacSeries>¶

Id

Type

Description

<CardiacSeries>

Group

Top level Group for <CardiacSeries>

  • Neurodata Type: CardiacSeries

  • Extends: TimeSeries

.data

Dataset

Associated cardiac-series data. Note that in general, this data could be a numerical array,the columns of which corresponding to the recording channels, indexed similarly as the rows of the dynamic table passed for the channels argument. Notice the difference between electrodes table and the recording channels.

  • Data Type: numeric

  • Name: data

..unit

Attribute

Default measurement unit of the corresponding cardiac-series.

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: unit

..which_channels

Attribute

Determine that the columns of data here corresponds to which recording channels. By default it is meant to be a one to one map to the recording channels table, passed to the ECGRecDevice container. A use case can be like <0: ch_0, 1:ch_2>, implying that the data is of two columns and the 0-th and 1-th columns correspond to ch_0 and ch_2 of all the recording channels, respectively.

  • Data Type: text

  • Value: One to one map with all the channels in ECGRecDevice.

  • Name: which_channels

..conversion

Attribute

Global conversion factor for corresponding cardiac-series. See also channel_conversion. finally, the stored data-set for each channel will be returned in default unit using the scaling as: data-in-default-unit = data * conversion * channel_conversion.

  • Data Type: float32

  • Value: 1.0

  • Name: conversion

.channel_conversion

Dataset

Conventional NWB channel-specific conversion factor. Default value would be 1. See also conversion. Finally, the stored data-set for each channel will be returned in default unit using the scaling as: data-in-default-unit = data * conversion * channel_conversion.

  • Quantity: 0 or 1

  • Data Type: float32

  • Name: channel_conversion

..axis

Attribute

Zero-indexed axis of the data that the channel-specific conversion factor corresponds to.

  • Data Type: int32

  • Value: 1

  • Name: axis

.recording_group

Link

Link to the ECGRecordingGroup as a reference for recording channels, recording electrodes and the recording device.

  • Target Type ECGRecordingGroup

  • Name: recording_group
Table 1.2 Groups contained in <CardiacSeries>¶

Id

Type

Description

<CardiacSeries>

Group

Top level Group for <CardiacSeries>

  • Neurodata Type: CardiacSeries

  • Extends: TimeSeries

.recording_group

Link

Link to the ECGRecordingGroup as a reference for recording channels, recording electrodes and the recording device.

  • Target Type ECGRecordingGroup

  • Name: recording_group

1.2.1.2. ECG¶

Overview: Specific data interface for ElectroCardioGram time-series (raw/processed).

ECG extends NWBDataInterface and includes all elements of NWBDataInterface with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Default Name: ECG

  • Inherits from: NWBDataInterface, NWBContainer, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.2

Table 1.3 Datasets, Links, and Attributes contained in <ECG>¶

Id

Type

Description

<ECG>

Group

Top level Group for <ECG>

  • Neurodata Type: ECG

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Default Name: ECG

.processing_description

Attribute

Explain how the time-series is processed or whether it is a raw acquisition.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: processing_description
Table 1.4 Groups contained in <ECG>¶

Id

Type

Description

<ECG>

Group

Top level Group for <ECG>

  • Neurodata Type: ECG

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Default Name: ECG

.<CardiacSeries>

Group

CardiacSeries object representing the ElectroCardioGram (ECG). Whether raw or processed.

  • Extends: CardiacSeries

  • Quantity: 1 or more
1.2.1.2.1. Groups: <CardiacSeries>¶

CardiacSeries object representing the ElectroCardioGram (ECG). Whether raw or processed.

  • Extends: CardiacSeries

  • Quantity: 1 or more

1.2.1.3. HeartRate¶

Overview: Specific data interface for HeartRate.

HeartRate extends NWBDataInterface and includes all elements of NWBDataInterface with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Default Name: HeartRate

  • Inherits from: NWBDataInterface, NWBContainer, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.3

Group

  • Neurodata Type: HeartRate

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Default Name: HeartRate

.processing_description

Attribute

Explain how the time-series is processed or whether it is a raw acquisition.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: processing_description

  • Neurodata Type: HeartRate

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Default Name: HeartRate

.<CardiacSeries>

Group

CardiacSeries object representing the HearRate (HR). Whether raw or processed.

  • Extends: CardiacSeries

  • Quantity: 1 or more
1.2.1.3.1. Groups: <CardiacSeries>¶

CardiacSeries object representing the HearRate (HR). Whether raw or processed.

  • Extends: CardiacSeries

  • Quantity: 1 or more

1.2.1.4. AuxiliaryAnalysis¶

Overview: Specific data interface for whatever relevant auxiliary in-between analysis.

AuxiliaryAnalysis extends NWBDataInterface and includes all elements of NWBDataInterface with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Default Name: AuxiliaryAnalysis

  • Inherits from: NWBDataInterface, NWBContainer, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.4

Table 1.7 Datasets, Links, and Attributes contained in <AuxiliaryAnalysis>¶

Id

Type

Description

<AuxiliaryAnalysis>

Group

Top level Group for <AuxiliaryAnalysis>

  • Neurodata Type: AuxiliaryAnalysis

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Default Name: AuxiliaryAnalysis

.processing_description

Attribute

Explain how the analysis is processed.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: processing_description
Table 1.8 Groups contained in <AuxiliaryAnalysis>¶

Id

Type

Description

<AuxiliaryAnalysis>

Group

Top level Group for <AuxiliaryAnalysis>

  • Neurodata Type: AuxiliaryAnalysis

  • Extends: NWBDataInterface

  • Default Name: AuxiliaryAnalysis

.<CardiacSeries>

Group

CardiacSeries object representing the auxiliary analysis.

  • Extends: CardiacSeries

  • Quantity: 1 or more
1.2.1.4.1. Groups: <CardiacSeries>¶

CardiacSeries object representing the auxiliary analysis.

  • Extends: CardiacSeries

  • Quantity: 1 or more

1.2.1.5. ECGRecordingGroup¶

Overview: Information of all electrodes, channels and the recording device from which the corresponding CardiacSeries is obtained.

ECGRecordingGroup extends LabMetaData and includes all elements of LabMetaData with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: LabMetaData

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Inherits from: LabMetaData, NWBContainer, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.5

Table 1.9 Datasets, Links, and Attributes contained in <ECGRecordingGroup>¶

Id

Type

Description

<ECGRecordingGroup>

Group

Top level Group for <ECGRecordingGroup>

  • Neurodata Type: ECGRecordingGroup

  • Extends: LabMetaData

.group_description

Attribute

Describe the recording channels for this specific experiment session.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: group_description

.recording_device

Link

Link to the ECGRecDevice used to record cardiac signals.

  • Target Type ECGRecDevice

  • Name: recording_device
Table 1.10 Groups contained in <ECGRecordingGroup>¶

Id

Type

Description

<ECGRecordingGroup>

Group

Top level Group for <ECGRecordingGroup>

  • Neurodata Type: ECGRecordingGroup

  • Extends: LabMetaData

.recording_device

Link

Link to the ECGRecDevice used to record cardiac signals.

  • Target Type ECGRecDevice

  • Name: recording_device

.electrodes

Group

An extended dynamic table of the implemented electrodes.

  • Extends: ECGElectrodes

  • Name: electrodes

.channels

Group

An extended dynamic table of the ECG recording channels.

  • Extends: ECGChannels

  • Name: channels
1.2.1.5.1. Groups: electrodes¶

An extended dynamic table of the implemented electrodes.

  • Extends: ECGElectrodes

  • Name: electrodes

1.2.1.5.2. Groups: channels¶

An extended dynamic table of the ECG recording channels.

  • Extends: ECGChannels

  • Name: channels

1.2.1.6. ECGRecDevice¶

Overview: ECG recording device.

ECGRecDevice extends Device and includes all elements of Device with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: Device

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Inherits from: Device, NWBContainer, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.6

Table 1.11 Datasets, Links, and Attributes contained in <ECGRecDevice>¶

Id

Type

Description

<ECGRecDevice>

Group

Top level Group for <ECGRecDevice>

  • Neurodata Type: ECGRecDevice

  • Extends: Device

.filtering

Attribute

Explain analogue frequency filtering of the ECG acquisition device, if any is implemented.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: filtering

.gain

Attribute

Explain the gain settings of the ECG acquisition device.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: gain

.offset

Attribute

Explain what the baseline of the ECG signal is set to.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: offset

.synchronization

Attribute

Explain the synchronization settings if the ECG recording device is separately connected to another recording system.

  • Data Type: text

  • Required: False

  • Name: synchronization

.endpoint_recording_device

Link

endpoint recording device to which the ECG recording device is connected.

  • Target Type Device

  • Name: endpoint_recording_device
Table 1.12 Groups contained in <ECGRecDevice>¶

Id

Type

Description

<ECGRecDevice>

Group

Top level Group for <ECGRecDevice>

  • Neurodata Type: ECGRecDevice

  • Extends: Device

.endpoint_recording_device

Link

endpoint recording device to which the ECG recording device is connected.

  • Target Type Device

  • Name: endpoint_recording_device

1.2.1.7. ECGElectrodes¶

Overview: Meta information of the electrodes from which the ECG signals are being recorded.

ECGElectrodes extends DynamicTable and includes all elements of DynamicTable with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: DynamicTable

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Name: electrodes

  • Inherits from: DynamicTable, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.7

Table 1.13 Datasets, Links, and Attributes contained in <ECGElectrodes>¶

Id

Type

Description

electrodes

Group

Top level Group for electrodes

  • Neurodata Type: ECGElectrodes

  • Extends: DynamicTable

  • Name: electrodes

.electrode_name

Dataset

Reference name of the corresponding electrode.

  • Extends: VectorData

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: electrode_name

.electrode_location

Dataset

Implementation location of the corresponding electrode.

  • Extends: VectorData

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: electrode_location

.electrode_info

Dataset

Descriptive information on the corresponding electrode

  • Extends: VectorData

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: electrode_info

1.2.1.8. ECGChannels¶

Overview: Meta information of the channels from which the CardiacSeries is obtained.

ECGChannels extends DynamicTable and includes all elements of DynamicTable with the following additions or changes.

  • Extends: DynamicTable

  • Primitive Type: Group

  • Name: channels

  • Inherits from: DynamicTable, Container

  • Source filename: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml

  • Source Specification: see Section 1.3.2.8

Table 1.14 Datasets, Links, and Attributes contained in <ECGChannels>¶

Id

Type

Description

channels

Group

Top level Group for channels

  • Neurodata Type: ECGChannels

  • Extends: DynamicTable

  • Name: channels

.channel_name

Dataset

Reference name of the corresponding recording channel.

  • Extends: VectorData

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: channel_name

.channel_type

Dataset

Type of the recording channel, e.g., single or differential.

  • Extends: VectorData

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: channel_type

.involved_electrodes

Dataset

Reference of the electrodes involved in the corresponding recording channel.

  • Extends: VectorData

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: involved_electrodes

.channel_info

Dataset

Descriptive information on the corresponding recording channel.

  • Extends: VectorData

  • Data Type: text

  • Name: channel_info

1.3. Schema Sources¶

Source Specification: see Section 1.3.1

1.3.1. ndx-ecg¶

Description: see Section 1.1.1

YAML Specification:

 1author:
 2- Hamidreza Alimohammadi ([AT]DefenseCircuitsLab)
 3contact:
 4- alimohammadi.hamidreza@gmail.com
 5doc: This extension is developed to extend NWB data standards to incorporate ECG recordings.
 6name: ndx-ecg
 7schema:
 8- namespace: core
 9  neurodata_types:
10  - TimeSeries
11  - Device
12  - NWBDataInterface
13  - LabMetaData
14- namespace: hdmf-common
15  neurodata_types:
16  - DynamicTable
17  - VectorData
18- source: ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml
19version: 0.1.0

1.3.2. ndx-ecg.extensions.yaml¶

1.3.2.1. CardiacSeries¶

Extends: TimeSeries

Description: see Section 1.2.1.1

YAML Specification:

 1datasets:
 2- attributes:
 3  - doc: Default measurement unit of the corresponding cardiac-series.
 4    dtype: text
 5    name: unit
 6  - doc: 'Determine that the columns of data here corresponds to which recording channels.
 7      By default it is meant to be a one to one map to the recording channels table,
 8      passed to the ECGRecDevice container. A use case can be like <0: ch_0, 1:ch_2>,
 9      implying that the data is of two columns and the 0-th and 1-th columns correspond
10      to ch_0 and ch_2 of all the recording channels, respectively.'
11    dtype: text
12    name: which_channels
13    value: One to one map with all the channels in ECGRecDevice.
14  - doc: 'Global conversion factor for corresponding cardiac-series. See also channel_conversion.
15      finally, the stored data-set for each channel will be returned in default unit
16      using the scaling as: data-in-default-unit = data * conversion * channel_conversion.'
17    dtype: float32
18    name: conversion
19    value: 1.0
20  doc: Associated cardiac-series data. Note that in general, this data could be a
21    numerical array,the columns of which corresponding to the recording channels,
22    indexed similarly as the rows of the dynamic table passed for the channels argument.
23    Notice the difference between electrodes table and the recording channels.
24  dtype: numeric
25  name: data
26- attributes:
27  - doc: Zero-indexed axis of the data that the channel-specific conversion factor
28      corresponds to.
29    dtype: int32
30    name: axis
31    value: 1
32  doc: 'Conventional NWB channel-specific conversion factor. Default value would be
33    1. See also conversion. Finally, the stored data-set for each channel will be
34    returned in default unit using the scaling as: data-in-default-unit = data * conversion
35    * channel_conversion.'
36  dtype: float32
37  name: channel_conversion
38  quantity: '?'
39doc: A group to store standardized cardiac time-series, e.g., ECG and HeartRate, including
40  acquisitions, processed cardiac series or auxiliary analysis.
41links:
42- doc: Link to the ECGRecordingGroup as a reference for recording channels, recording
43    electrodes and the recording device.
44  name: recording_group
45  target_type: ECGRecordingGroup
46neurodata_type_def: CardiacSeries
47neurodata_type_inc: TimeSeries

1.3.2.2. ECG¶

Extends: NWBDataInterface

Description: see Section 1.2.1.2

YAML Specification:

 1attributes:
 2- doc: Explain how the time-series is processed or whether it is a raw acquisition.
 3  dtype: text
 4  name: processing_description
 5  required: false
 6default_name: ECG
 7doc: Specific data interface for ElectroCardioGram time-series (raw/processed).
 8groups:
 9- doc: CardiacSeries object representing the ElectroCardioGram (ECG). Whether raw
10    or processed.
11  neurodata_type_inc: CardiacSeries
12  quantity: +
13neurodata_type_def: ECG
14neurodata_type_inc: NWBDataInterface

1.3.2.3. HeartRate¶

Extends: NWBDataInterface

Description: see Section 1.2.1.3

YAML Specification:

 1attributes:
 2- doc: Explain how the time-series is processed or whether it is a raw acquisition.
 3  dtype: text
 4  name: processing_description
 5  required: false
 6default_name: HeartRate
 7doc: Specific data interface for HeartRate.
 8groups:
 9- doc: CardiacSeries object representing the HearRate (HR). Whether raw or processed.
10  neurodata_type_inc: CardiacSeries
11  quantity: +
12neurodata_type_def: HeartRate
13neurodata_type_inc: NWBDataInterface

1.3.2.4. AuxiliaryAnalysis¶

Extends: NWBDataInterface

Description: see Section 1.2.1.4

YAML Specification:

 1attributes:
 2- doc: Explain how the analysis is processed.
 3  dtype: text
 4  name: processing_description
 5  required: false
 6default_name: AuxiliaryAnalysis
 7doc: Specific data interface for whatever relevant auxiliary in-between analysis.
 8groups:
 9- doc: CardiacSeries object representing the auxiliary analysis.
10  neurodata_type_inc: CardiacSeries
11  quantity: +
12neurodata_type_def: AuxiliaryAnalysis
13neurodata_type_inc: NWBDataInterface

1.3.2.5. ECGRecordingGroup¶

Extends: LabMetaData

Description: see Section 1.2.1.5

YAML Specification:

 1attributes:
 2- doc: Describe the recording channels for this specific experiment session.
 3  dtype: text
 4  name: group_description
 5  required: false
 6doc: Information of all electrodes, channels and the recording device from which the
 7  corresponding CardiacSeries is obtained.
 8groups:
 9- doc: An extended dynamic table of the implemented electrodes.
10  name: electrodes
11  neurodata_type_inc: ECGElectrodes
12- doc: An extended dynamic table of the ECG recording channels.
13  name: channels
14  neurodata_type_inc: ECGChannels
15links:
16- doc: Link to the ECGRecDevice used to record cardiac signals.
17  name: recording_device
18  target_type: ECGRecDevice
19neurodata_type_def: ECGRecordingGroup
20neurodata_type_inc: LabMetaData

1.3.2.6. ECGRecDevice¶

Extends: Device

Description: see Section 1.2.1.6

YAML Specification:

 1attributes:
 2- doc: Explain analogue frequency filtering of the ECG acquisition device, if any
 3    is implemented.
 4  dtype: text
 5  name: filtering
 6  required: false
 7- doc: Explain the gain settings of the ECG acquisition device.
 8  dtype: text
 9  name: gain
10  required: false
11- doc: Explain what the baseline of the ECG signal is set to.
12  dtype: text
13  name: offset
14  required: false
15- doc: Explain the synchronization settings if the ECG recording device is separately
16    connected to another recording system.
17  dtype: text
18  name: synchronization
19  required: false
20doc: ECG recording device.
21links:
22- doc: endpoint recording device to which the ECG recording device is connected.
23  name: endpoint_recording_device
24  target_type: Device
25neurodata_type_def: ECGRecDevice
26neurodata_type_inc: Device

1.3.2.7. ECGElectrodes¶

Extends: DynamicTable

Description: see Section 1.2.1.7

YAML Specification:

 1datasets:
 2- doc: Reference name of the corresponding electrode.
 3  dtype: text
 4  name: electrode_name
 5  neurodata_type_inc: VectorData
 6- doc: Implementation location of the corresponding electrode.
 7  dtype: text
 8  name: electrode_location
 9  neurodata_type_inc: VectorData
10- doc: Descriptive information on the corresponding electrode
11  dtype: text
12  name: electrode_info
13  neurodata_type_inc: VectorData
14doc: Meta information of the electrodes from which the ECG signals are being recorded.
15name: electrodes
16neurodata_type_def: ECGElectrodes
17neurodata_type_inc: DynamicTable

1.3.2.8. ECGChannels¶

Extends: DynamicTable

 7  dtype: text

11  dtype: text

14- doc: Descriptive information on the corresponding recording channel.
